questions.question_text:
An engineer must configure a new Cisco UCS B-Series infrastructure with a Cisco 5108 chassis. The configuration must meet these requirements:

• The setup must use aggregation between Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects and I/O modules.
• The implementation requires four 10 GbE connections per I/O module.
• The Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects must support uplinks of different speeds for future expansion.

Which two steps must be taken to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
To meet the specified requirements for configuring a Cisco UCS B-Series infrastructure with a Cisco 5108 chassis, the following two steps are essential:

D. Set Link Group Preference to Port Channel.
Setting the Link Group Preference to Port Channel ensures that the connections between the Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects and the I/O modules are aggregated into a port channel. This configuration is crucial for meeting the requirement of using aggregation between the fabric interconnects and I/O modules. It helps in achieving redundancy and increasing bandwidth.
B. Set IOM link pinning in Global Policies.
Setting the IOM (I/O Module) link pinning in Global Policies ensures that the I/O modules are properly configured to use the required number of connections (in this case, four 10 GbE connections per I/O module). Pinning helps in maintaining consistent connectivity and managing how the links are distributed and aggregated.

comments.content: Cannot be B, because you are using aggregation and port-channel then has to be A and D

comments.content: Wrong me, we are talking about a restore, so Full State -A

discussion.content: C. System config includes usernames db

Selected Answer: A
Full state—A binary file that includes a snapshot of the entire system. You can use the file generated from this backup to restore the system during disaster recovery. This file can restore or rebuild the configuration on the original fabric interconnect, or recreate the configuration on a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for an import.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-2/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-2/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html

questions.question_text: An engineer must replace a defective fabric interconnect with the same model. The system must be restored, including the database of locally created users. The equivalent Cisco UCS Manager software version must be used. Which backup type must be used to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
D is correct

immediate—The server is rebooted automatically as soon as the service profile association is complete or service profile changes are saved by the user.

user-ack—The user must reboot the server manually after the service profile association is complete or changes are made.

timer-automatic—Cisco UCS defers all service profile associations and changes until the maintenance window defined by the schedule shown in the Schedule field.

questions.question_text: Which Cisco UCS firmware reboot policy must be used in the maintenance policy to prevent the server firmware from upgrading automatically and wait for user input before proceeding?
